alternative_parents.description: Organosilicon compounds where the tetravalent silicon atom is linked to one or more heteroatoms.
alternative_parents.name: Organoheterosilanes

alternative_parents.description: Organic salt compounds containing a metalloid atom in its ionic form.
alternative_parents.name: Organic metalloid salts

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds that contain one or more oxygen atoms.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxygen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

class.description: Organic compounds containing a metalloid atom.
class.name: Organometalloid compounds

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as siloxanes. These are saturated silicon-oxygen hydrides with unbranched or branched chains of alternating silicon and oxygen atoms (each silicon atom is separated from its nearest silicon neighbours by single oxygen atoms). The general structure of unbranched siloxanes is H3Si[OSiH2]nOSiH3. H3Si[OSiH2]nOSiH[OSiH2OSiH3]2 is an example of a branched siloxane. By extension hydrocarbyl derivatives are commonly included.

direct_parent.description: Saturated silicon-oxygen hydrides with unbranched or branched chains of alternating silicon and oxygen atoms (each silicon atom is separated from its nearest silicon neighbours by single oxygen atoms). The general structure of unbranched siloxanes is H3Si[OSiH2]nOSiH3. H3Si[OSiH2]nOSiH[OSiH2OSiH3]2 is an example of a branched siloxane. By extension hydrocarbyl derivatives are commonly included.
direct_parent.name: Siloxanes

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Organic compounds containing a C[Si] bond.
subclass.name: Organosilicon compounds

superclass.description: Organic compounds containing a bond between a carbon atom and metal atom.
superclass.name: Organometallic compounds
